meanings.definition: The transfer of a business, industry, or service from public to private ownership and control.
meanings.sent1: The privatization of the water supply led to higher prices for consumers.
meanings.sent2: Many countries have embraced privatization as a way to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The privatization of the park meant no more free concerts for the public.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to privatize her closet organization was a game-changer.
meanings.sent5: The privatization of the library made it feel exclusive and luxurious.

meanings.definition: The act of making something privately owned or controlled.
meanings.sent1: Privatization of the company resulted in layoffs for many employees.
meanings.sent2: The privatization of the internet has raised concerns about data privacy.
meanings.sent3: His privatization of the cookie jar led to a family feud over snacks.
meanings.sent4: The privatization of her diary turned it into a personal treasure.
meanings.sent5: The privatization of the beach resort made it feel like a private paradise.
